moves.1. c4 f5: Blacks reply is typical of the Dutch opening....
moves.2. g3 Nf6 3. Bg2 d6 4. Nc3 e5: ...i like this opening as Black...I use it myself up to a point, but deviate with a differing plan from Black in this game. This opening for Black gives a very simple but aggressive plan of a kingside attack. Typically supported with Qh5, Ng4 and exchanging the white bishop on g2..this can be dangerous for build up positional openings like the English....!
moves.5. d3 Be7 6. Nf3 O-O 7. O-O: ...if black chose c6,Na7-c7, Qe8-h5 and then g5...this would be a quick attack..another route is taken..but still a kingside attack
moves.8... a6 9. Rb1: ..typical move in the English....gives flexibility of queenside advance ..
moves.10. Nd5: ...decision is to remove the key knight on f6....and gain a tempo with cxd5
moves.10... Nxd5 11. cxd5 Nd8 12. b3: ..decided the strategy will be hold solid in the centre...wait for the kingside storm and drive throught the c file..
moves.12... Nf7 13. Qc2 Bd8: ...normally the black bishop is looking to get to c7 for the long diagonal...but he cant play c6 for the moment...
moves.14. Bb2 g5: ...a bit early...? King will be exposed if the pawns breakdown...
moves.15... h5: ...bit too much air around the black king now...
moves.16. f4 g4: black is going all in ..I am expecting Nh6 with Qh5 to follow...Kg7 & Rh8 gives an attack...
moves.17. Qc3: ..time to build pressure on e5 & kingside...
moves.17... Kh7 18. Nc4 Bf6 19. fxe5: ...time to jab at that wall...and see if it crumbles...
moves.20... h4: ..as long as i keep the h file closed this is fine...
moves.21. exf5: ...e4 loses the bishop, just now picked up a pawn..
moves.21... h3 22. Be4: ..more pressure on the king..so i thought i need to re-route and bump that dark square bishop/....
moves.22... Nd6: ..taking the knight only helps black...Nxe4 solidifies for white with dxe4...so i chose to add another piece to the mix...
moves.23. Rbe1 Nf7: ...i want to get at the very airy g file...so need to pull the bishop out of the way to introduce the threat Rf4
moves.24. Bh1 b5: ..helps me re-route the knight to threaten g4
moves.25. Ne3 Rg8: ..this is where black is now in trouble...d6 and the game is over quite quickly...too many threats coming really quick..! Ra8 is attacked, Nd5 is coming threatening a forkand i have 2 rooks slamming down the e & d files....its gets nasty ...
moves.26. d6 Bd7: ...i am thinking that the idea is Bxa8 is a distant threat of Qxa8 looking at Qg2# but this is easily met....
moves.27. Nd5: ...such a nasty threat...bishop is under threat, Rook on a8 is in danger..all bad for black...
moves.27... Qd8: ...well this is the end really..so how to bring the end....
moves.28. dxc7:
...Rc8 will be answered by a nice combo...cxd8=Q. Black cannot take on c3 owing to a forced mate (..Nxf6  leads to Qxg8 and mate on g6)

Quick end...will take it as a win for the team....
